com.noctarius.borabora.builder.encoder

Interface IndefiniteByteStringBuilder<B>

  • Type Parameters:
    B - the parent builder's type

    public interface IndefiniteByteStringBuilder<B>
    The IndefiniteStringBuilder interface is used to create a string that consists of an indefinite number of independent strings. This is useful to generate a stream where the string generation is chunked. While reading the string is deserialized as a single, continuous element.

    A IndefiniteStringBuilder instance is retrieved by calling ValueBuilder.putIndefiniteByteString() or ValueBuilder.putIndefiniteTextString().

    Depending on the previously chosen method, the stream either all has to consist of ASCII ByteStrings or UTF-8 TextStrings. Trying to put a string, that contains UTF-8 characters, into a IndefiniteStringBuilder that was created with ValueBuilder.putIndefiniteByteString() will throw an IllegalArgumentException.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      B endIndefiniteByteString()
      Ends the current indefinite bytestring and write the closing tag to the generated CBOR stream.
      IndefiniteByteStringBuilder<B> putByteString(byte[] value)
      Encodes a new byte[] chunk at the current position into the CBOR stream.

    • Method Detail

      • putByteString

        IndefiniteByteStringBuilder<B> putByteString(byte[] value)
        Encodes a new byte[] chunk at the current position into the CBOR stream. If value is null, a NullPointerException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to encode
        Returns:
        the current builder

      • endIndefiniteByteString

        B endIndefiniteByteString()
        Ends the current indefinite bytestring and write the closing tag to the generated CBOR stream.
        Returns:
        the parent builder
